Good and Precise resumes TYPES used recently by B Corp companies, giant multinational companies
ChatGPT said:

B Corp companies and multinational giants prefer modern, clean, and results-driven resumes. The most commonly used resume types are:

1. Reverse-Chronological Resume (Most Preferred)

  • Structure: Lists work experience starting with the most recent.
  • Best for: Senior professionals, executives, and those with strong career progression.
  • Why? Highlights measurable achievements and leadership impact.
  • Preferred Format: One-Page or Two-Page (for senior roles).

2. Hybrid/Combination Resume

  • Structure: Mix of skills-based and chronological sections.
  • Best for: Those transitioning industries or with a mix of FMCG & pharma experience like yours.
  • Why? Showcases both expertise and career progression.
  • Preferred Format: ATS-friendly with bullet points.

3. Modern Minimalist Resume (For Digital-First Companies & Leadership Roles)

  • Structure: Clean, bold headlines, concise text, and strong emphasis on numbers/impact.
  • Best for: Senior executives & those applying to B Corps emphasizing sustainability & impact.
  • Why? Focuses on business outcomes, strategy, and leadership.
  • Preferred Format: 1-page, key accomplishments upfront.

4. Infographic & Visual Resume (Less Common, but Used in Creative Fields & Startups)

  • Structure: Uses charts, icons, and timelines for visual appeal.
  • Best for: Marketing & brand leadership roles in FMCG & digital-focused companies.
  • Why? Grabs attention quickly, but must remain ATS-compatible.
  • Preferred Format: PDF with text-readable elements for ATS scanning.

For B Corps & Multinational Giants, the best approach is Reverse-Chronological or Hybrid, ensuring itâ€™s ATS-friendly, concise, and metrics-driven.
